business.headline: Explained: Why Mazagon Dock share price tumbled 5% after Q1 resultsThe Mazagon Dock Shipbuilders stock was down 4.50% to Rs 2,664.25 on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE) at 10:34 am. In a month, the stock has tumbled 18%, still up almost 19% this year.

Laxmi India Finance IPO open for bidding: Should you subscribe? Check detailsThe IPO includes a fresh issue of 1.05 crore shares worth Rs 165.17 crore and an offer for sale of 56 lakh shares worth Rs 89.09 crore.
Sensex opens 200 points lower, Nifty below 24,700; Infosys down 1%The S&P BSE Sensex was down by 62.31 points to 80,828.71, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 7.20 points to 24,673.70 as of 9:26 am.

Who is P&G's new Indian-born global CEO, Shailesh JejurikarShailesh Jejurikar's promotion was announced as part of a leadership change at P&G. The company's current CEO, Jon R. Moeller, will move into the role of executive chairman.

Aditya Infotech IPO open for bidding: Should you subscribe? Check GMPThe bidding window will remain open till July 31, 2025. Aditya Infotech IPO consists of a fresh issue worth Rs 500 crore and an offer for sale (OFS) of shares worth Rs 800 crore by promoter group entities.

Brigade Hotel Ventures IPO allotment: Step-by-step guide to check statusThose who applied for shares can check their allotment status either on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE) website or through the portal of KFin Technologies Limited, the official registrar for this IPO.

Should you be paying rent with credit card?More and more people are using credit cards to pay rent. But does the benefit of extra days to pay and cashback outweigh the fees and credit score impact? Let's break it down.
Sensex ends 572 points lower, Nifty below 24,700; Kotak Bank down 7%The S&P BSE Sensex lost 572.07 points to end at 80,891.02, while the NSE Nifty50 was down by 156.10 points to close at 24,680.90.

5 IPOs worth Rs 7,000 crore to open for bidding this week. Check detailsThis week, five mainboard IPOs are opening for bidding: NSDL (National Securities Depository), M&B Engineering, Sri Lotus Developers & Realty, Aditya Infotech, and Laxmi India Finance.

Can opting for old regime help you save tax in FY25?Many believe that under the new tax regime, there is no tax on income up to Rs 12 lakh. However, this change will only take effect from April 1, 2025, and will apply to returns filed for the FY26.

Edelweiss' Radhika Gupta slams Dior for ignoring Indian artisans behind $200K coatThe luxury brand Dior showcased a $200K coat adorned with traditional Lucknowi 'mukaish' embroidery. While 12 Indian artisans spent 34 days crafting it, their names, and India's contribution, went unacknowledged.

Is TCS cutting jobs because of AI? Here's what CEO K Krithivasan saysTCS CEO K Krithivasan said that the company is still looking for highly skilled professionals, especially those who can support TCS's plans to expand into new technologies and markets.

entertainment.headline: Bend It Like Beckham 2 coming soon? Filmmaker Gurinder Chadha hints at something newDirector Gurinder Chadha has confirmed that a sequel to her hit 2002 film 'Bend It Like Beckham' is in development. She hopes to bring back the original cast and build on the film's legacy of empowering women in sports.

Kyunki reboot is here and Tulsi's new look is pure nostalgia, reimaginedTulsi Virani is back, redefined, regal, and ready for a new era. Catch Smriti Irani's iconic return in the 'Kyunki Saas Bhi Kabhi Bahu Thi' reboot, tonight.

Arjun Rampal pays tribute to best friend Rohit Bal at India Couture Week 2025. WatchArjun Rampal paid tribute to late fashion designer and his best friend Rohit Bal at India Couture Week 2025. He turned showstopper and wore his collection at the event.

Hari Hara Veera Mallu box office Day 5: Pawan Kalyan film nosedives, earns Rs 2 crorePawan Kalyan's 'Hari Hara Veera Mallu' crashed at the box office on Monday on its fifth day in theatres. The film earned Rs 2 crore nett in India, which is more than a 50 per cent drop.

Avatar Fire and Ash trailer: Sullys, Na'vi set for war on land, air and waterJames Cameron's 'Avatar: Fire and Ash' trailer was released early after a leak, heightening anticipation for the December 2025 film release. The trailer gave a glimpse of a full-blown war between the Sullys, Na'vi and Mangkwan clan.

In Vijay Deverakonda's Kingdom, the rise, slump and the road to redemptionVijay Deverakonda has experienced a rollercoaster career marked by major hits and crushing failures. His upcoming film 'Kingdom' is seen as a crucial chance to revive his standing in Telugu cinema.

Saiyaara singer Faheem Abdullah collaborates with T-Series for new music projects'Saiyaara' singer Faheem Abdullah is all set for new beginnings in his music career. The singer-songwriter-composer has partnered with Bhushan Kumar's T-Series for his future music projects.

Taarak Mehta makers begged Disha Vakani to return, co-star Jennifer Mistry opens upActor Jennifer Mistry Bansiwal, best known as Roshan from 'Taarak Mehta Ka Ooltah', shed light on Disha Vakani's exit from the show. She also revealed the behind-the-scenes efforts to bring her back.

Bakaiti trailer: Rajesh Tailang, Sheeba Chaddha navigate middle-class strugglesThe upcoming show 'Bakaiti' on ZEE5, is a slice-of-life story about a middle-class family in Ghaziabad. The series highlights everyday struggles and unspoken love in a household while dealing with chaos and generational tensions.

Ahaan Panday's private Instagram grabs attention amid Saiyaara craze'Saiyaara' actor Ahaan Panday's potential private Instagram account has come to light. The account is followed by popular celebrities like Ananya Panday and Khushi Kapoor.

20 years later, Shah Rukh Khan's Swades BTS pics go viral, fans get nostalgicThrowback BTS photos from Shah Rukh Khan's film 'Swades' have gone viral, bringing back memories for fans. People praised the film for showing Indian culture and said it should be released in theatres again.

Tanishk Bagchi denies Saiyaara track being copiedTanishk Bagchi denies allegations of copying tunes for 'Saiyaara' from One Direction and Jubin Nautiyal. The original Hindi track's global chart success challenges his image as just a recreation composer.

Hina Khan shares funny video with mother-in-law on shaadi ke side effectsActor Hina Khan shared a light-hearted video showcasing her relationship with her mother-in-law on Instagram. She playfully mentioned in the caption that the video is about the side effects of marriage.

Mahesh Bhatt says Alia is self-made, calls Ranbir laid-back: She is a go-getterVeteran producer-director Mahesh Bhatt recently called his daughter Alia Bhatt a self-made actor. Apart from Alia, he also shared his views on why son-in-law Ranbir Kapoor is a laid-back actor.

Parmeet Sethi recalls marital struggles with Archana Puran Singh: It was very tenseActor Parmeet Sethi opened up about his personal and marital struggles. He credited the Art of Living course for helping him find emotional peace during tough times with his wife Archana Puran Singh.

John Abraham hugs fan imitating Allu Arjun's Pushpa Raj, video goes viralJohn Abraham recently met a fan dressed as Pushpa Raj from Allu Arjun's film 'Pushpa'. The actor was so impressed by his act that he hugged him, and the video quickly went viral.

Hari Hara Veera Mallu poor VFX edited: Fans wonder why wasn't it done earlierActor Pawan Kalyan's epic-action-drama 'Hari Hara Veera Mallu: Part 1—Sword vs Spirit' was re-released in theatres with trimmed scenes and enhanced VFX. The changes caught the attention of movie-goers who questioned why it wasn't done earlier.

Mallika Sherawat sets record straight, says not doing Bigg Boss 19 and never willActor Mallika Sherawat confirmed on Monday that she will not be joining 'Bigg Boss 19'. She addressed rumours on her Instagram story, stating that she will never be seen on the show.

Rupali Ganguly seeks blessings from Lord Shiva at Mahakaleshwar temple, shares pics Rupali Ganguly visited the Mahakaleshwar temple in Ujjain with her husband to seek Lord Shiva's blessings on Sawan Somvar. The 'Anupamaa' star shared pictures from the spiritual visit, which are now going viral on social media.

general news.headline: Manish Tewari's cryptic post after Congress benches him for Sindoor discussionBoth Manish Tewari and Shashi Tharoor were part of the government's all-party delegations that travelled to various countries in the wake of Operation Sindoor.

Nimisha Priya's Yemen execution cancelled claim inaccurate: Government sourcesThe office of Grand Mufti of India claimed that Nimisha Priya's death sentence had been officially cancelled. The government has now rejected the claim.

Officer killed in New York shooting was Bangladeshi immigrant with pregnant wifeThe 36-year-old New York Police Department officer, Didarul Islam, was married, had two young sons, and his wife is pregnant with a third child, the city's police commissioner said.

Heavy rain batters Delhi, waterlogging paralyses city; airlines issue advisoryWaterlogging was reported in several parts of Delhi, slowing down traffic and affecting movement. Visuals shared by news agency ANI showed commuters wading through rain-hit roads, highlighting the impact of the downpour across the city.

Ben Stokes: Snubbed handshakes, swollen toes, and the 2019 World Cup robberyBen Stokes tried to play Gandhi with his handshake act in Manchester. But he will do well to remember how, only hours before that, he targetted Rishabh Pant's busted foot with searing yorkers.

I failed in life: 23-year-old Pune engineer jumps from office building, diesAn IT engineer in Pune was reportedly attending a meeting when he suddenly complained of chest pain and excused himself before jumping from the seventh floor of the office building.

4,000 tonnes of coal go missing in Meghalaya, minister blames the rain godsAfter the Meghalaya High Court questioned the government on the missing coal, the minister had an unusual answer: heavy rain might have washed it all away.

Why Jagdeep Dhankhar's exit as vice-president will have little impact on BJPObservers believe Dhankhar was aptly rewarded for all that he might have done for the BJP. Few in the party are shedding public tears for him

Kyunki reboot is here and Tulsi's new look is pure nostalgia, reimaginedTulsi Virani is back, redefined, regal, and ready for a new era. Catch Smriti Irani's iconic return in the 'Kyunki Saas Bhi Kabhi Bahu Thi' reboot, tonight.

MS Dhoni of the Chessboard: Meet Divya Deshmukh, new Women's World Cup winnerDivya Deshmukh showcased her remarkable ability to thrive under pressure by clinching the FIDE Women's World Cup 2025 title, a performance that drew comparisons to Indian cricket legend MS Dhoni for her calm temperament and finishing prowess on the biggest stage.

Migrant worker hung upside down, beaten with sticks in Gurugram; 4 arrestedIn the viral video, a group of men can be seen beating a migrant worker who was hung upside down at a construction site in Sector 38 in Haryana's Gurugram.

Video: Amit Shah loses cool as Opposition boos Jaishankar during Op Sindoor debateAmit Shah lashed out at the Opposition in Parliament after they repeatedly interrupted External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar during his statement on Operation Sindoor.

US woman lists 'absurd things' foreigners hear when married to Indians. Watch videoAn American woman who has been living in India for nineteen years has now shared a video describing the challenges she faced being married to an Indian man.

Bus carrying kanwariyas collides with truck in Jharkhand, BJP MP says 18 killedInspector General (Dumka Zone) Shailendra Kumar Sinha told PTI that the 32-seater bus carrying Kanwariyas collided with a truck near Jamuniya forest in Mohanpur police station in Deoghar.

Video: Thar rams scooter in Jammu, driver reverses to hit elderly riderA Thar SUV hit an elderly man twice in Jammu, leaving him critically injured. Following the collision, which took place on Sunday, the driver fled the scene without assisting the injured man.

We sent them willingly: Families of girls deny conversion charges against nunsThe arrest of two Kerala nuns and a tribal man in Chhattisgarh has sparked protests nationwide, after the families of the three tribal women involved denied forced conversion and trafficking allegations.

In Vijay Deverakonda's Kingdom, the rise, slump and the road to redemptionVijay Deverakonda has experienced a rollercoaster career marked by major hits and crushing failures. His upcoming film 'Kingdom' is seen as a crucial chance to revive his standing in Telugu cinema.
In Bihar's 'Phulera', panchayat secretary takes on MLA, files case after threatIn his complaint, the panchayat secretary accused RJD MLA Bhai Virendra of hurling casteist abuse and issuing threats.

Mamata Banerjee claims Bengali family assaulted by Delhi police, cops refuteThe video shared by Mamata Banerjee showed a child with scratches on his ear, followed by visuals of a woman making allegations of assault by Delhi Police.

BJP's new renaming call in Bhopal has a Pakistan angle: Why the row?The demand is over Hamidia Hospital and Hamidia College, named after Hamidullah Khan, the last Nawab of Bhopal accused by some BJP leaders of being pro-Pakistan

Crumbling classrooms: India's public schools have become death traps for childrenSeven students died in Rajasthan's school roof collapse on Friday, exposing India's chronic underfunding of school infrastructure where accidents like this aren't surprising but tragically predictable.

5 dead in shooting at Manhattan building housing top firms, gunman killedA shooting at a midtown Manhattan office building, home to top companies like Blackstone, KPMG, Deutsche Bank, left five people dead, including a police officer.

What is UPA's 2009 Balochistan blunder of Sharm El-SheikhResponding to the Opposition during the debate on Operation Sindoor, Foreign Minister S Jaishankar accused the UPA-2 government of inaction after the 2008 Mumbai attacks and referred to the 2009 Sharm El-Sheikh joint statement by then PM Manmohan Singh with his Pakistani counterpart Yusuf Raza Gilani. What is the Sharm El-Sheikh statement and its reference to Balochistan that is considered a blunder by the Singh-led UPA government?

Surat woman assaulted, gangraped by husband and friends, thrown into river to dieA man in Surat brutally assaulted his wife and gangraped her with his friends over suspicion of an extramarital affair. They attempted to kill her by throwing her into the river.

Bend It Like Beckham 2 coming soon? Filmmaker Gurinder Chadha hints at something newDirector Gurinder Chadha has confirmed that a sequel to her hit 2002 film 'Bend It Like Beckham' is in development. She hopes to bring back the original cast and build on the film's legacy of empowering women in sports.

Arjun Rampal pays tribute to best friend Rohit Bal at India Couture Week 2025. WatchArjun Rampal paid tribute to late fashion designer and his best friend Rohit Bal at India Couture Week 2025. He turned showstopper and wore his collection at the event.

Hari Hara Veera Mallu box office Day 5: Pawan Kalyan film nosedives, earns Rs 2 crorePawan Kalyan's 'Hari Hara Veera Mallu' crashed at the box office on Monday on its fifth day in theatres. The film earned Rs 2 crore nett in India, which is more than a 50 per cent drop.

Avatar Fire and Ash trailer: Sullys, Na'vi set for war on land, air and waterJames Cameron's 'Avatar: Fire and Ash' trailer was released early after a leak, heightening anticipation for the December 2025 film release. The trailer gave a glimpse of a full-blown war between the Sullys, Na'vi and Mangkwan clan.

sports.headline: Ajinkya Rahane flags major concern for India ahead of final Test matchFormer captain Ajinkya Rahane has flagged a major concern for the Indian Test team going into the final Test match of the series. Rahane believes that the Indian bowling unit has failed to turn up as a group.

Australia blank West Indies in 5th T20I, finish tour with 8-0 aggregateAustralia completed a dominant whitewash against West Indies, winning all eight matches of their tour. Australia beat West Indies by 3 wickets in the final match of the series.

Ben Stokes: Snubbed handshakes, swollen toes, and the 2019 World Cup robberyBen Stokes tried to play Gandhi with his handshake act in Manchester. But he will do well to remember how, only hours before that, he targetted Rishabh Pant's busted foot with searing yorkers.

Ravindra Jadeja earns overdue recognition as reliable Test batter in EnglandEngland vs India: Averaging 113.50 with four half-centuries and a century in eight innings, Ravindra Jadeja has not only reaffirmed his quality with the bat but also earned the long-overdue recognition as a reliable Test batter in England.

Khaleel Ahmed ends Essex stint early due to personal reasonsIndia left-arm pacer Khaleel Ahmed has withdrawn from his County Championship stint with Essex after featuring in just two first-class matches, citing personal reasons.

Why should India be nice to England? Boycott slams Ben StokesFormer England opener Geoffrey Boycott has slammed the Ben Stokes-led England team for their tactics and behaviour on Day 5 of the Manchester Test, questioning the drama that unfolded when Indian batters refused to settle for a draw.

KL Rahul like a monk, Jadeja the real deal: Aakash Chopra praises Indian duoKL Rahul's composed knock and Ravindra Jadeja's match-saving century helped India secure a draw in the fourth Test against England. Aakash Chopra lauded both players for their resilience, highlighting Rahul's disciplined approach and Jadeja's all-round brilliance as pivotal in keeping India's hopes alive in the series.

Supreme Court quashes FIR against Lakshya Sen in birth certificate forgery caseThe Supreme Court on Monday (July 28) quashed an FIR against national badminton star Lakshya Sen, along with his family members and coach, in a case related to alleged birth certificate forgery.

MS Dhoni of the Chessboard: Meet Divya Deshmukh, new Women's World Cup winnerDivya Deshmukh showcased her remarkable ability to thrive under pressure by clinching the FIDE Women's World Cup 2025 title, a performance that drew comparisons to Indian cricket legend MS Dhoni for her calm temperament and finishing prowess on the biggest stage.

Virat Kohli was set to be sacked as RCB captain in 2019, reveals ex IPL-teammateMoeen Ali revealed that Parthiv Patel was almost appointed RCB captain in 2019 during Gary Kirsten's coaching tenure. Virat Kohli, however, continued leading the side until 2021 when he decided to step down due to workload concerns.

Guardiola reveals plans after Manchester City stint, hints at decade-long breakPep Guardiola has reiterated his plan to step away from football management after his tenure at Manchester City, revealing that his sabbatical could last as long as 15 years.

KL Rahul like a monk, Jadeja the real deal: Aakash Chopra praises Indian duoKL Rahul's composed knock and Ravindra Jadeja's match-saving century helped India secure a draw in the fourth Test against England. Aakash Chopra lauded both players for their resilience, highlighting Rahul's disciplined approach and Jadeja's all-round brilliance as pivotal in keeping India's hopes alive in the series.

Supreme Court quashes FIR against Lakshya Sen in birth certificate forgery caseThe Supreme Court on Monday (July 28) quashed an FIR against national badminton star Lakshya Sen, along with his family members and coach, in a case related to alleged birth certificate forgery.

MS Dhoni of the Chessboard: Meet Divya Deshmukh, new Women's World Cup winnerDivya Deshmukh showcased her remarkable ability to thrive under pressure by clinching the FIDE Women's World Cup 2025 title, a performance that drew comparisons to Indian cricket legend MS Dhoni for her calm temperament and finishing prowess on the biggest stage.

Virat Kohli was set to be sacked as RCB captain in 2019, reveals ex IPL-teammateMoeen Ali revealed that Parthiv Patel was almost appointed RCB captain in 2019 during Gary Kirsten's coaching tenure. Virat Kohli, however, continued leading the side until 2021 when he decided to step down due to workload concerns.

Guardiola reveals plans after Manchester City stint, hints at decade-long breakPep Guardiola has reiterated his plan to step away from football management after his tenure at Manchester City, revealing that his sabbatical could last as long as 15 years.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
